text: While at times it can be unfunny, obnoxious, and even hurtful, Jim Carrey’s performance, as well as more than a few decent laughs, leaves this remake being - not great, but a passable Christmas film.

I absolutely love this movie. Jim Carrey’s How the Grinch Stole Christmas has been one of my all-time favorite holiday films ever since it came out, and I’ve watched it at least once every single year. No matter how old I get, it still hits the same way it did the first time.

Jim Carrey gives one of the greatest comedic performances ever put on screen — not just for a Christmas movie, but for any movie. His energy, expressions, the voice, the physical comedy, the timing… everything is perfect. You can tell he put everything he had into the role. Nobody else could have played the Grinch with that same balance of sarcasm, humor, heart, and chaos.

The world of Whoville is fun, colorful, and full of personality, and the film does an amazing job expanding Dr. Seuss’s classic story into a full movie without losing the original spirit. The makeup, costumes, music, and sets still look incredible even today. For a movie made over twenty years ago, it’s held up unbelievably well.

What makes it special is that it’s not just funny — it’s genuine. Under all the jokes and sarcasm, the movie has a big heart. The message about kindness, acceptance, and finding joy again always hits home, especially around the holidays. Jim Carrey brings so much emotion to the character that you actually feel for the Grinch by the end.

This isn’t just a Christmas movie for me — it’s a tradition. It’s something I can put on every year and know it’ll make me laugh, put me in a good mood, and remind me what the holidays are supposed to feel like. It’s timeless, and it gets better every time I watch it.

Jim Carrey absolutely made this movie iconic, and it will always be one of the best holiday films ever made.
